name: European Association of Urology
goal:
To act as the representative body for European urologists and facilitate the continued
development of urology and all its supraspecialties;
• To foster the highest standards of urological care throughout Europe;
• To encourage urological research and enable the broadcasting of its results;
• To promote contributions to the medical and scientific literature by its members;
• To promote European urological achievements worldwide;
• To establish European standards for training and urological practice;
• To contribute to the determination of European urological health care policies;
• To disseminate high quality urological information to patients and public
interests: Digital economy and society, Education and training, Employment and Social Affairs, Public Health, Regional Policy, Research and innovation, Single market, Trans-European Networks, Youth
euInitiatives:
EU Public Health Policy
ipaac Joint Action on cancer.
The EU Cancer Plan and the research mission on cancer.
European Reference Networks, and cross border patient rights.
Research and innovation programmes (Horizon Europe) ,
HTA, medical devices and medicines legislation
mutual recognition of professional qualifications, continuous professional development, Erasmus, Marie-Curie etc .
Digitalisation of health and care - AI, and Robotics.
Digital Europe (workforce development)
